job_title: Mental Health Technician in Rocky Mount, NC
pros: The pay for my position is good (I'm a CNA). We do get bonuses every year, sometimes two, if we reach our goals for the year. I've been there five years and have gotten three raises. There is opportunity for overtime and you will get compensated well for it. There is opportunity for growth. If you want to go back to school, they will help you. The staff is nice. You can make your own schedule. They do not pay into Social Security but they have a retirement plan that matches 100%. They also offer 401k. Employee pharmacy is very, very cheap. Health insurance is reasonable as long as you fill out your forms to get the discounts (turn in information for one doctor's appointment and non-smoker). Insurance is also offered to part-time employees.
cons: I prefer 8 hour shifts and its all 12 hour shifts (its 36 hour full time) for clinical staff but I guess that's how most hospitals operate. I have experienced burnout but I think its due to the population of patients I work with. The cafeteria food is good but its expensive even with our employee discount. We've had a lot of policy changes since COVID and we don't always get the memo. When I first started, 5 years ago, management did not micro-manage staff. Now they do.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Raleigh, NC

job_title: Registered Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: They offered schedule flexibility and decent PTO.
cons: Pay was adequate. They had very laid out policies and procedures but the rules would be bent if they were short staffed. If there wasn’t any room for a step down patient on the step down unit, they became a floor patient which is unsafe. Staff were pressured to “climb the clinical ladder” and join a bunch of useless committees. These committees would come up with extra tasks for nurses to do daily which did not provide better care for patients, just more work/charting for nurses. When staffing is short, nurses are expected to pick up the slack (transport patients, clean patient rooms, assist PT/OT with mobility, provide case management assistance). They also expect staff to attend monthly meetings in person even if it’s your day off, you can’t call into the meeting. Parking is a mess. You pay to park in a park and ride lot and then take a bus into work. So a one hour meeting becomes a 3 hour ordeal.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chapel Hill, NC
pros:
I’ve worked in the Neuro ICU for the last 3 years, and am relocating for my husband’s job. I can confidently say that the management in the Neuro ICU has advocated for me, listened to my concerns, provided feedback, and supported me professionally as well as personally the past three years.  Upper management (Director of Surgery Services, CNO, etc) is very approachable and I’ve had many personal conversations with them when they round the units.

 The teamwork on this unit is also second to none, and it’s a good environment to learn. The providers we work with listen to us and care about us learning so we can understand our patients better. There are plenty of opportunities for educational classes as well as professional growth and involvement. 

Through COVID we have had plenty of PPE and leadership has been transparent with where we are at. I can’t speak for every unit, but will always recommend NSICU as a great place to work.
cons: Parking is frustrating, I’ve been fined multiple times and wait lists are long for on-campus parking.

review_title: Great place to work...horrible IT Structure
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Durham, NC
pros: UNC Health Care is a great place to work.  One of the perks is that they made modifications to the state benefit package to subsidize health care insurance, 401k, etc. to make the benefits package more appealing.  As not only an employee, but a patient and a family member of a patient, the place high emphasis on quality of care, which is something that you can pride yourself in as an employee.
cons: The organization is growing faster that their IT infrastructure can support.  Systems go down frequently.  There is no career development and growth opportunities.  It appears as though the department would rather bring on an external candidate versus promoting someone from within who has already grown accustom to the environment at UNC Health Care, and it's needs.  Within my work unit, IT micromanages and makes decisions without thinking of the impact that this will have to the individual support teams.  There is no cohesiveness between work areas within IT.  Ultimately, I would return to UNC Health Care, but definitely in a different capacity than my previous role.

If someone needs help, the other team members are right there to pitch in. Everyone here has one goal- to do what is best for the patient. I would definitely recommend UNC Healthcare as not only a great place to work, but also to be a patient or student. UNC offers many benefits to its employees. Besides PTO, there are many different types of insurance to choose from including dental, medical, vision, auto,disability, and life. UNC takes part in the State of North Carolina Teachers and State Employees Retirement plan as well as offering 401Ks for those who desire.

review_title: Lack of Diversity within the Workplace, Immature Behavior Among Employees
job_title: Analyst in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: State benefits and free parking.
cons:
- Extreme lack of diversity when it comes to the faculty within the UNC Health Foundation. It became clear during my time there that a lot of the departments take a liking to a certain type of demographic with similar viewpoints.

- Tolerance of inappropriate behavior from younger employees seems to be ongoing. I witnessed co-workers act unkindly towards other employees in an effort to isolate them from the team. Gossiping and other non-work related distractions seemed to be ongoing there.

- Expectations to volunteer weekends on an ongoing basis for fundraising events seemed inconsistent with job role requirements and created an unhealthy level of competition among employees.

job_title: Healthcare Specialist in Durham, NC
pros: Most employees try to do a good job and are nice.
cons: At UNC Homecare Specialists, upper management has no clue but they are great con artists and have convinced higher ups that they can bring positive change. Upper management has refused to ask credentialed staff how processes may be improved. Upper management and especially my direct supervisor are extremely disrespectful, rude and even hateful at times. They treat professional employees with complete disdain. They have already driven out two excellent lower level managers and want everything done their way, regardless if it makes sense. They refuse to even ask for employees' input on how our processes can be improved, even though many employees have been there many years. Professional staff are treated like dirt.

review_title: The  NURSE'S are great to work with on all shifts.
job_title: HUC in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Nurses REALLY care about patients. Most M.D. services also provide great patient care.
cons:
1) My unit changed Nurse Managers every few months. They stayed long enough to get their new Nurse Managers card punched and then they moved to more stable Units in the hospital.
2) My unit was in CONSTANT CHAOS.
3) Top management had no compassion for front line employees.
4) Management did not take ideas or input from those below them.!!
5) Top management pays " Lip Service" to TQM etc but it really is the Top Down Communication Model established decades .
6) Advancement  DEFINITELY depends on if you are in the manager's click. This is a common theme through A LOT of reviews on Glassdoor concerning UNC CHAPEL HILL

review_title: A hospital located inside a Sports Arena
job_title: Medical Laboratory Technologist in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: People love working at UNC Healthcare.  The quality of care is top notch, the employees and physicians are some of the best in the country.
cons: The biggest downside (and it is a BIG one) is the commute.  Unless you live right in Chapel Hill and ride your bike to work, plan on adding at least half an hour each way to you daily commute due to traffic and the Park and Ride system.  And good luck getting to work on UNC game days! Not only is traffic  worse than usual, but all of the parking spots near campus are reserved for football/basketball attendees.  This is a large hospital located inside a large university/sports campus.  It is easy to see where the priorities lie, especially on game day.

review_title: Emphasis on Productivity, Highly qualified PTs
job_title: Physical Therapist in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Working for a large hospital organization means that you don't have to worry about getting enough referrals or marketing to the general public. Outpatient treatments are 1-1 with the average length being 45 min per session. Great healthcare plan for employees and overall good benefits. Good on boarding program for new employees.
cons: Minimal documentation time included in your daily schedule. Overall the hospital doesn't seem to value physical therapy as much as other hospital systems I've worked at which is disappointing. Salary is low. There is a big push for productivity and a focus on numbers rather than quality/complexity of treatments, as is the trend with PT unfortunately.

job_title: Administrative Director in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Good Benefits. Many excellent lower level employees,
cons: Unfriendly managers and directors who are not interested in honest professional opinions. They are much more interested in getting "yes" answers and asking managers to do busy work that makes the institution appear to  be something it is not.  No place for advancement unless you belong to the "club."  Once they lure you in, there is no room for growth or even to utilize your professional skills.  But the pay is good, so it is difficult for me to leave until something as good turns up.

review_title: Great environment to get nursing experience
job_title: CNA in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: From the standpoint of a CNA looking to have nursing experience, this hospital is great as they get difficult cases that outside hospitals can't handle. I float, so I go to different units. I have met many RNs who truly enjoy their jobs and care for their patients. Hospital does show employee appreciation through festival ticket giveaways or similar other ways.
cons: Can't speak about benefits as I work per diem. I have heard many employees complain about salaries though. Parking is off-site, need to take a shuttle.

review_title: Good benefits, too much micro management
job_title: Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Good health and retirement benefits.  Decent PTO.   Most departments have a good Dr/Nurse relationship.    Good resources and programs for staff and patients.
cons: Micro management with priority given to budget.   Management cannot do the jobs they manage in most cases.  Nurse to patient ratio is pushed to the limits.      Employees pay a good amount for parking.   Pretty high staff turn over.

job_title: CNA in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: I loved the people I worked with and the work that I did. My healthcare benefits were great as well as the PTO.
cons: My position was not paid well for what they did compared to other positions, I was in direct patient care I saw a lot of emotionally draining things as well as miracles this was all hard on my body and mind and the people at starbucks made more an hour than I did.

job_title: Revenue Cycle Representative in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Scheduling is flexible. You really don't have many problems taking time off.
cons: The atmosphere can be very toxic due to management's lack of transparency and favoritism. The pay is decent; however, there are inconsistencies in expectations. The overall feeling is underpaid, overworked and underappreciated. There is very little room from growth and when you do try to expand your growth they try to block you. For the most part, if they like you in your position, prepare to be there for a while.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Morrisville, NC
pros: Benefits are great and PTO is awsome with the amount that is given.
cons: They give you a 9 month probation period. Any where else it is 90 days. Very unprofessional from top to bottom. It seem like everybody does just enough work not to get fired. And if you actually shine they try to boot you out the door. Not just management but your fellow co workers. Plus new employees come in making more than people thats been there for years.

review_title: Same struggles as most public hospitals, but making a real effort to overcome them.
job_title: in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Great facility and good pay. They are making real efforts to improve the tense culture that can arise from a stressed out work environment.
cons: Like many public hospitals, too much work to be done by too few people. Management's stress over staying in budget trickles down to the staff. To be fair, this is a US health care system problem and not specifically a UNC Health Care problem.

job_title: Manager in Raleigh, NC
pros: Prestigious organization, quality colleagues committed to providing excellent patient care, fast-paced work environment, growing network, increasing opportunities in convenient locations.
cons: Leadership is knowingly driving excessive/extreme expectations for an "at all costs" work environment, leading to high burn-out rate of quality, experienced professionals. Leadership possesses an arrogant attitude of entitlement that business ethics and labor laws don't apply to them and violations, if reported, cannot be proven against the massive, influential UNC system.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Employees really care about patient experience.  Everyone asks how they can help.   It is a very cooperative place to work, and physicians, other providers, nurses, and other staff all work well together.  Very good benefits, including tuition assistance for full-time employees.  There are many opportunities to contribute to work life policies.
cons: Parking is difficult and expensive.  If you don't want to pay the premium to park near the hospital, they do offer park and ride options, but some of the buses do not leave late enough in the evening.  If you miss the last bus, you're stuck with the shuttle, which can make for a very long day.

job_title: Staff RN in Raleigh, NC
pros: I can honestly say out of the multiple hospitals I have worked this facility is the best.   Great benefits, great staff, great employee perks, scheduling is great.  Management consistently pushes to better themselves and move up the clinical ladder.  Immediately pays for 3 state classes a local colleges and after a year will pay for any degree with 6 month required stay after graduation.
cons: No downside unless you like drama then it can be a con for you.  If you come to work do your job you are golden.

review_title: Great company to work for! Excellent Benefits and awesome morale!
job_title: in Raleigh, NC
pros:
Programs to help employees out in financial binds
Programs to help during family crises
A good place to start
cons:
Politics in some units and favoritism override accomplishments and hard work 
You are expendable, no matter what you believe
They will not, under any circumstances, help you after you've left their employ 
If you are a single parent (especially male) be expected to fight for your job if you have to take off for your kids; even if that's twice a year.

job_title: Accounting Technician in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Vacation time is great and schedules are flexible. Two to three percent bonuses every fall, plus  merit and market increases every year based on reviews and pay bands.
cons: The pay bands are low, quite a bit lower than the UNC Chapel Hill pay bands. The health insurance isn't as good as you would expect working for a hospital. HR does not release general job descriptions to compare to your duties or other titles.

review_title: Collection agent is what you will be.
job_title: Financial Counselor in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Its a job, clinic staffs are super friendly and great to work with, state job that pays biweekly, great food and employee discount.
cons: Misleading job description, awful management, offsite parking, low pay compared with the workload, 9 months probationary period, must use PTO time for holidays and clinic closings, treated like a commodity and can be relocated in a moments notice, high collections goals.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Great overall environment to work in especially when meeting patients and families. They help to keep things in perspective.
cons: Way too many middle managers coasting and top-level managers who do not step from the Ivory Tower long enough to meet staff. There is quite a bit of "trickle down effect" that happens with decisions made. Rarely are front line staff elevated through the ranks because of hard work and dedication.

review_title: Great teamwork and people, difficult work-life balance
job_title: ICU Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Everyone is friendly and respectful to each other - the rude person is an odd man out here. People have a sense of humor and camaraderie. The food is actually pretty good and I buy hospital food fairly regularly.
cons: The work/life balance is difficult as a shift working nurse. Even nurses with many years on a unit may still be required to rotate. We may get lots of PTO, but we can't use more than two (maybe 3) weeks a year for vacation. The healthcare options are expensive for a family.

job_title: Staff Development Technician in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: I work with some of the nicest people I have ever worked with my entire career.  My building is off campus and parking is easy.
cons: It is very difficult for administrative professionals to move ahead and get promoted at UNC Health Care.  They is no system in place to move up the ladder.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: The work environment was very good. Each employee wants to help the others succeed, and the administrators care about the employees. It's hard work, but its a good environment to work in.
cons: I don't really have much negative to say about working at UNC health care. The work can be hard and being a state job, raises aren't always the best, but UNC does try to give good benefits compared to other state employers.

job_title: Moa in Kenly, NC
pros: Working with the PA at this clinic was a great experience
cons: The management is young and likes to use her "management status" by demanding respect when she doesn't deserve it.  Management is hired by who you know not by their qualifications.  Management plays favorites - if management doesn't like you or is intimidated by you because you do your job and do not need them, they will find a way to get rid of you.

job_title: in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Competitive salary. Good retirement. Decent health benefits but they are cheaper over at Duke Hospital.
cons: Terrible management, on every unit. Too many chiefs not enough Indians. Hospital politics more important that patient care. Horrible parking situation for hospital employees. Parking garage is owned by the university and they have no respect for hospital employees. Will ticket and tow your car in the blink of an eye.

job_title: Radiation Oncology Nurse in Smithfield, NC
pros: The location worked for me. It was a change of pace. Good food in the cafeteria. The patients are the best part.
cons: Horrible management within the Rex Oncology center. By horrible I mean spiteful and will alter rules on a whim according to political agenda. Lots of gossip in the office and yet poor communication when it came to matters of consequence. I turned in my notice and now have been given more work from other facilities for the duration of my notice as well as extended hours. Trust me when I say, I wouldn’t recommend this place to my worst enemy. Thank goodness for other options.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Great place to learn and contribute as a member of a health team, State benefits are great if you are looking to stay long term , although there has been a cut in recent years. The PTO is best I have seen
cons: Salaries tend t be on lower end of spectrum as well as pay raises.

job_title: CST II in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Good PTO, benefits, and competitive pay.  Self scheduling of shifts is very convenient.  OT is always available, but not required.
cons: Parking is awful - you have to ride the bus from a Park and Ride, which you have to pay for.  If you have an on campus permit, which are very expensive and require years on a waiting list, you still usually have to move your vehicle on game days.

job_title: Stock Clerk in Durham, NC
pros: The company itself is great to work for, awesome benefits
cons: People are too busy minding other folk business rather than learning their job. Too many want to be bosses and the leaders have no idea what they're doing too many inexperience folk in charge who knows nothing about logistics. Inventory jacked all up.

review_title: If you need benefits, it's about the only reason to work here.
job_title: Residency Coordinator in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Benefits, it's a job, maybe it's close to where you live
cons: This place is so bad that if I wrote what honestly happened during my time, there is no way in hell you would believe me. So, I'll say this: you will only want to take a job at UNC Health if you are in desperate need for a job. If you have options, this is not the place for you to work. If you don't believe me, revisit this review after working there for one year and prove me wrong.

job_title: Clinical Nurse II in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: 3 credit hours free college classes/semester, 5 years vested retirement, state benefit package
cons:
Parking at the Main Campus is terrible. UNC requires all the ICU RNs to rotate dayshift & nightshift, and most of the floors do the same. After 12 months this becomes exhausting a leading cause of RNs moving to smaller institutions. 

UNC also comes with all the positives & negatives of being a state's flagship teaching hospital.

job_title: Business Manager in Wake Forest, NC
pros: There are a lot of hard-working employees
cons:
-Pay was low, relative to position
-Failure to disclose that to potential hired that he/she won't be able to park on site and have to park and ride which increases commute time tremendously;
-Pretty political and encouraged entitlements
-CFO does not value accounting / finance staff's contributions and think he can underpay b/c they come "a dime in a dozen"

review_title: My experience at Unc healthcare was Great ,I enjoyed what I was doing.A Great place to work.
job_title: Anesthesia Techinain in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: I like the way everyone worked as a team,and anything you have a question about was answered. I like the environment and I learned many skills and the hands on the Doctor would teach you something different ,to better your skills.
cons: The pay wasn't great but I loved what I was doing so much ,it didn't matter to me.

review_title: Good pay and benefits but patient transport  manager is very two faced.
job_title: Patient Transporter in Chapel Hill, NC
pros:
1.Good exercise(walking around hospital alot!)
2.Good pay
3.Benefits 
4.Work by yourself and with others
5.Fun to work as a team
cons:
1.Time crunching.
2.Alot of walking(HUGE hospital).
3.Need to feel comfortable in a hospital or else it will get to you.
4. Can feel like your in high school in some areas.
5.Your body will be exhausted if you are full time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Holly Springs, NC
pros: Large healthcare organization with many resources, good nursing policies and protocols, use of electronic medical record system allows better continuation of care for patients, uses evidence-based practices.
cons: Some nurse managers don't understand the business aspect of their job. Some doctors and mid-level providers complain about patients all day long. Not enough staff to cover breaks makes for a very long day.

job_title: in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Flexibility in making my own schedule. Everyday suppose to be different. Some floors are more staff friendly, but overall I love helping and taking care of patients.
cons: Attendance method needs to be readdressed.  Pay raises are needed for per diem employees, who do the most for the hospital.  Much is required from that department and little given.

review_title: Absolutely love working for this hospital
job_title: Registered Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: They care about their employees and everyone is so friendly. Truly feels like you are part of a family and the teamwork is amazing. The hospital and system is constantly expanding and attracting talent and innovation.
cons: The parking is less than desirable. You have to take a shuttle until you get off the waitlist for an on campus pass. Parking is owned by the university, not the hospital.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Raleigh, NC
pros: Not one single thing about this place.
cons: Poor Management, threatening work environment

job_title: RN At UNC in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: the support you receive from the management at unc health care is excellent. you will find encouragement to go back to school for a higher degree, to move up the clinical ladder and to balance work and home life.
cons: since acquiring several small hospitals unc health care has down graded our pto package to match what is offered at the smaller hospitals now under the unc health care umbrella. this has caused concern in long term employees.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Pay is good.  Mileage reimbursement is good.  Chance to make extra money with PPV.  The amount for PPV is high.  Great City to work in and great surrounding cities.  Lots of things to do if moving to the area.  I liked the 8-5 deal. would still go back and work with this company.
cons: lots of turnover with management, CM tend to be overloaded with patients.  Salaried for 40hr/wk but work more like 50hr/wk.

job_title: Resident Physician in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Great people, great ancillary staff. Variety and severity of medical conditions is appropriate for a training physician. Attending physicians are good educators and role models.
cons: Patients can be difficult due to multiple comorbidities and poor follow up and follow through on care plans. Salary is low in comparison to other companies, however benefits are good.

job_title: CNA in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: I get to make my own schedule and I only have to work 3 times a week, so I am able to continue with school and have a life outside of work. The state insurance is very affordable. I love it and I am a diabetic and I am able to afford my supplies for my insulin pump =)
cons: You have to wait 6-9 months if you want to transfer to another floor.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Raleigh, NC
pros: Agile management team that works well together to problem solve.  Co-workers enjoy working at Rex and share in its vision.
cons: Changing environment as many services are shared with the health system.  Not as user friendly or accurate as those services once were.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Raleigh, NC
pros: Friendly staff that make people feel like family (as often you spend more time with them than your family), leading to an enjoyable work environment, wonderful physicians
cons: Work-life balance is challenging at times but that is the nature of the job, Pay rates need to be reevaluated, benefits are not good.

job_title: in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: An incredible hospital nationally recognized and located in a great area.  The focus is on helping the people which makes any job more worthwhile.
cons: It can often be a dull environment with spotty leadership.  I work in the business offices, so we don't get much action.

review_title: Nursery Attendant, UNC Wellness Centers at meadowmont
job_title: Nursery Worker in Kenosha, WI
pros: Good work experience opportunity for a young person
cons: Sexual harassment, inaction by management, harrassment, bullying, inconsistent hours, frequently cancelled shifts the day of or called with less than an hours notice requesting you to fill a shift, not a safe work environment, ruled to be a hostile work environment by HR

job_title: Dietetic Assistant in Poway, CA
pros: Benefits are great for full-time employees. Offer tuition reimbursement and financial incentives throughout the year for employees. FNS Department is welcoming and encouraging to those who want to further their career in the field of food and nutrition.
cons: Lacking in motivational incentives for hourly employees. Supervisory staff in Patient Services Department can be authoritative, and instigates improper food handling practices. Should have all leadership staff obtain Servsafe certification.

job_title: Pharmacy Department in Chapel Hill, NC
pros:
Excellent medical and retirement benefits (state employee)
Competitive salary
Tuition reimbursement program
Free scrubs provided
Starbucks inside the hospital
Sounds good on resume
cons:
Speaking for pharmacy department only:
-Absence of standards for hiring
-Poor communication within department
-Lack of proper, effective training protocol. New employees are trained by whichever employee happens to be covering the position they are to be trained on. No regard is taken as to the skill and knowledge of the training employee. This essentially leads to 20 different ways of doing a single task, which eventually leads to mistakes.
-Even though housekeeping came through twice a day, the facilities were disgusting. It needed much more than a sweep and occasional mopping. 
-I expected a cutting edge, state of the art facility. What I found was a place stuck in the past, and unwilling to make changes to keep pace. When I was hired, in 2002, I was told of plans for development and improvement. When I left, 8 years later, those same plans were still being discussed. 
-Upper management's lack of knowledge of departmental operations. They tend to just see things in the "big picture", or like the way ideas sound on paper. They seemed to ignore the opinions of those actually working those ideas. I expect anyone in a leadership position to know the job of those they are writing the rules for, so well, that at anytime they could walk in and perform that job at a superior level

I am not a disgruntled employee, nor did I leave this organization on bad terms. Many things within the department only started to decline within the past couple of years. My opinions of my workplace for the first six years were outstanding. I felt appreciated, respected, and looked forward going to work everyday. There was not a single point or change that occurred that triggered this downturn, it was a slow progression. I hope that these issues will be addressed and corrected in the future.

job_title: technischer Zeichner / CAD Konstrukteur in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Competitive salaries, decent bonus program.  Good benefits.   Communication to employees has improved over the last several years.
cons: Medical insurance programs not the best. Only 80/20 or 70/30 choices.  After employee only option insurance becomes expensive.  Limited career opportunities on the horizon with the arrival of a vendor based EMR system.  Vendor-lock.  Would recommend working here to a friend with reservations.

job_title: Information Specialist in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Friendly coworkers, great benefits and employee recreation/wellness programs, and academic assistance. They are always pushing for improvement which makes work challenging but not boring. And, despite their size, they take they take the time to recognize employees.
cons: Parking. But they have park & ride lots and the town of Chapel Hill has a free bus system.

review_title: Staff was very judgmental and only helped you if they liked you
job_title: Nursing Assistant in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: The benefits there are great! And the pay rate was great! You could sign up for overtime to make extra cash!
cons: If you don't meet there standards they judge you! They didn't want to treat me fairly because I wasn't in nursing school

job_title: Utilization Review Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Good benefits, yearly bonus, internal job options, state retirement

review_title: Best Place I've worked so far
job_title: Clinical Nurse in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: Good clinical ladder, amazing group togetherness and teamwork mentality, and management overall (both clincal and corporate) listen and act on input from staff. Always growing and support movement of staff within the company.
cons: Politics like everywhere else. Slow on annual raises, but they can and do come and they also have usual great staffing to fill the need for the units.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Chapel Hill, NC

You will not be supported, your concerns will not be addressed, and yes the broken thing will remain broken from the day you report it until the day you leave, even if it is possibly a hazard to workers or patients.

job_title: Research Assistant in Chapel Hill, NC

job_title: Certified Ophthalmic Assistant in Chapel Hill, NC

review_title: The work isn't hard to do, but sometimes it gets tedious
job_title: Assistant in Chapel Hill, NC

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chapel Hill, NC
pros: technically 8-5pm M-F no Holidays no weekends. work with brilliant amazing people, get to talk to patients with many needs.-

review_title: Pretty Good Place To Be A Nurse
job_title: RN, Bsn in Chapel Hill, NC

job_title: Digital Marketing Specialist in Chapel Hill, NC

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chapel Hill, NC

job_title: Surgical Technologist in Raleigh, NC
pros: I have worked here for some 25+ years and didn't want to leave but we must move in to retirement and i found out i hate this retirement.

job_title: Eligibility Representative in Chapel Hill, NC

benifits and 401 K options and stocksharing
bonuses
room to grow upwards within the company

job_title: ER Medical Scribe in Chapel Hill, NC
